alert.note: Alert for Central Beaufort Sea Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 10 at 3:22PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM AKDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...Sagavanirktok and Kuparuk Rivers near Deadhorse. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM AKDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas along the Kuparuk and Sagavanirktok Rivers. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 300 PM AKDT, Between 2 and 3 inches of rain fell Friday night and Saturday in the Northeast Brooks Range and caused minor flooding on the upper Sagavanirktok and Kuparuk Rivers. This high water is now moving downstream and is expected to reach the coast by this evening and gradually fall on Tuesday. - For Kuparuk River nr Deadhorse: At 2:45pm the stage was 35.51 feet. Flood Stage is 35.5 feet. Forecast: A crest around 35.9 feet is expected around 10:00pm Monday. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood - If you are along the Sagavanirktok or Kuparuk River, stay alert and be prepared to take action.
